passages.text: USA | Aerospace & Defense Electronics
What's Up in Space: Starship, ISS Biotech, Launch Infrastructure

In this weekly report, we highlight key events and implications for the space sector: 1) SpaceX Starship completes tenth flight test with a successful launch; 2) Redwire \(\) 25\mathrm{MM}\$ NASA ID/IQ for on- orbit biotech support on ISS; 3) Aerospacelab raises \(\) 110\mathrm{MM}\$ for production facility expansion; 4) Rocket Lab completes 70th Electron launch, stands up new Neutron launch pad.

SpaceX Starship Completes A Successful Tenth Test Flight. SpaceX's Starship completed its tenth test flight with the successful launch putting the program back on track following failures on the last three test flights. The ascent appeared successful excluding the premature shutdown of one of 33 Raptor engines in the Super Heavy booster, with the Starship reaching its planned suborbital trajectory. The mission also included the deployment of eight mass simulators of next- gen Starlink satellites. Starship had a successful controlled reentry to its targeted splashdown zone in the Indian Ocean.

Redwire To Provide Biotech On- Orbit Ops at ISS. Redwire was awarded a NASA single award \(\) 25\mathrm{MM}\$ ceiling five year ID/IQ to fulfill future task orders for biotechnology facilities, on- orbit operations support, mission integration, and related services for the agency on the ISS. Under the contract, RDW was recently issued a \(\) 2.5\mathrm{MM}\$ task order from NASA's In Space Production Application (InSPA) program to support additional drug development investigations on the ISS using Redwire's PIL- BOX technology. Redwire will provide services to manage, integrate, and facilitate experiments and support on- orbit operations for NASA- funded life and material sciences research investigations on the ISS that are processed every year.

Aerospacelab Raises \(\) 110\mathrm{MM}\$ For Satellite Production. Aerospacelab, a Belgian satellite maker, has raised \(\) 94\mathrm{MM}\$ ( \(110\mathrm{MM}\) ) to expand manufacturing capacity. The company has now raised a total of \(\) 134\mathrm{MM}\$ . The funds are expected to go toward the completion of its "Megafactory" in Belgium that can support capacity to manufacture up to 500 satellites per year by 2027 with production of 150 to 700kg satellites kicking off in early 2026. Current named customers include Xona Space Systems, Albedo, JAXA/Mitsui Bussan Aerospace of Japan and ESA/European Defense Agencies. Aerospacelab is differentiating through designing and producing subsystems in- house and leveraging commercial off- the- shelf components to cut costs and lead times. Aerospacelab has deployed nine satellites to date. Aerospacelab has been shortlisted to build \(>290\) mostly LEO satellites by SpaceX/ISE (EC backed consortium of SES, Eutelsat, and Hispasa) with a target service date of 2031. The company is currently in the RFI phase with SpaceX/ISE as it assesses technical maturity, development road maps and production capacity with the RFP phase to open Sept 20th and supplier selection before year end.

RockeLab Launches 5 Sats on 70th Electron Flight. A Rocket Lab Electron launched five satellites for a confidential commercial customer marking the 70th overall liftoff for its Electron rocket and 1th mission of 2025. The launch was from Rocket Lab's New Zealand site.

Rocket Lab Inaugurates Neutron Launch Pad. Rocket Lab officially opened its Launch Complex 3 at the Mid- Atlantic Regional Spaceport. The new site is expected to host Neutron launches, with the first launch of the rocket planned for as early as the end of this year. Rocket Lab has designed the pad to minimize the cost and time needed to refurbish in between launches. This includes a design to be able to turn in 24 hours. Construction of the launch complex started in late 2023 and included 700 tons of steel and 140 cubic meters of concrete.

Elbit JUPITER Space Camera Launches on NAOS Satellite. Elbit Systems JUPITER space camera successfully launched on a National Advanced Optical Systems satellite. The NAOS satellite, manufactured by OHB Italia, will support a wide- band of earth observation missions, including military operations, environmental monitoring and scientific research. Elbit's camera is an advanced space camera featuring a very large aperture and lightweight design with multispectral across a combination of imaging channels. This includes a high- resolution panchromatic channel, RGB channel along with a near- infrared channel. In addition to the camera, Elbit Systems also developed and supplied advanced algorithms to support the NAOS mission ground system.

ESA and EC Awards Two Launch Contracts. ESA has signed the first awards under the Flight Ticket Initiative, a joint program with the European Commission. The Flight Ticket Initiative is meant to help European companies and organizations test technologies in orbit along with provide new competitive opportunities for European launch companies. One contract to carry three payloads went to Avio with another for two payloads to Isar Aerospace. Avio is expected to fly the three payloads as secondaries on an unspecified future Vega C launch. Isar will carry two payloads on a Spectrum launch which is scheduled for no earlier than next year. In January 2024, Isar Aerospace, Orbex, PLD Space, Arianespace (since then Avio has taken over launch services/marketing of Vega C) and Rocket Factory Augsburg were selected to compete for future launches under the program.
We present What's Up in Space reports published in the past several months.

We arrive at our price target for ESLT using a blended average of P/E, EV/EBITDA, and FCF yield off our 2026 estimates. Risks include Defense budgets.
We value Redwire on 2027E PF EV/EBITDA. Risks include program delays, funding constraints, rising competitive pressures from new companies, and risk to M&A integration.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed
Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period.
Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period.
Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period.

The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10,\) the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10,\) the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue

stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
